item.title: Report E-2023090783
item.description:
Report E-2023090783

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: Connersville
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1 drum of waste can in from Brook and Whittle. Lab determined that material was hazardous. Flash point < 140F. Material was shipped without a D001 waste code. I am doing the notification that the waste was shipped as an undeclared hazardous material.

item.title: Report E-2023090745
item.description:
Report E-2023090745

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: TAYLORSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stopped in rout at a rest area and was doing a load check and noticed a clear liquid dripping form the trailer. The driver then call out Emergency Response Line and a crew was sent to the location. The Crew showed up within the hour to start the clean up process. The crew put on the proper PPE and entered the trailer to find the appropriate container. The container was located midway in the trailer and pin hole in the bottom of the 55 Gallon drum was found to be the cause. they used absorbent cloths and material to collect what had been released. The absorbents and the damaged drum was put into a salvage drum to be disposed of properly.

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into 2 of the metal 5 gallon cans of lacquer thinner (un1263) releasing 10 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090265
item.description:
Report X-2023090265

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: NEW HAVEN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer was being unloaded before QA arrived. Unload manager made sure area was cleared and contacted QA once one was available. Spill was contained by absorbent pads and package was secured into a bagged tote to await processing. DescribePack: Cap of one bottle had fallen off. Cap looks intact so it may not have been secured before shipping. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent pads were used immediately to slow spread. Belt was stopped and other packages were held back to prevent contamination.

item.title: Report I-2023080049
item.description:
Report I-2023080049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T00:33:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: GREENSBURG
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LPG LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7-25-23: A driver inadvertently loaded Ammonia, Anhydrous (UN1005) into a storage tank designated for Propane (UN 1075). As part of the recovery and remediation, the storage tank offloaded into two tanker trailers (MC331 ). On 7-27-23, the pressure relief valve on one of the recovery tanker trailers released a mixture of Ammonia and Propane in to the atmosphere. The release was caused by an increase in pressure caused by an Exothermic Reaction between the two commodities. The valve reset, but an unknown quantity of product was lost. As a result, representatives from PHMSA, the Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Indiana State Police and independent response personnel developed a new and more timely recovery procedure (Liquid Flare). The remaining products were safely rendered safe and the incident was declared complete. A copy of the report from the recovery/remediation company is attached. Risk Management of East Central Indiana LLC. NOTE: The carrier responsible is LPG Logistics LLC USDOT# 3142354. LPG Logisitics is the Owner/Operator Branch of C Three Logistics LLC USDOT# 2961868. LPG Logistics is the responsible party; however, billing and information is handled by C Three Logistics.
